rdf:Description.lla:note: Maggie Louder could be Maggie Lauder of Liverpool. Also listed on Release of 1867-04-22

Logbook for voyage notes that on Feb 15th at about 2pm in Cardiff, 'John Edmonds AB was very drunk and refused to proceed to sea from West Bute Dock' though there was a 'fair wind'. The Master employed a 'Hobler' in Edmonds' room for 5 shillings, then Edmonds was taken to the 'Station' and the next morning the Master appeared to prosecute him but the magistrate ordered Edmonds on board. A boat was hired to take the three refusing sailors on board. Also listed on Release form of 1867-04-22.
Last ship most likely John & Mary. Separate Release form.

Logbook notes that on Feb 15th in Cardiff 'William Griffiths refused to go to sea on the grounds that John Edmond would not go', a 'hobler' was hired and Griffiths was taken before the magistrate and ordered on board. Also listed on Release form of 1867-04-22
Listed additionally on 'Account of Changes in Crew of Foreign-Going Ship'

Logbook notes that on Feb 15th in Cardiff, David Lloyd 'refused to go to sea on the grounds that … John Edmond would not go'. A 'hobler' was hired. David Lloyd was taken to the magistrate and ordered on board. Listed additionally on 'Account of Changes in Crew of Foreign-Going Ship' as Substitute for Thomas Jones. Also listed on Release form of 1867-04-22
Listed separately under 'Account of Apprentices on Board'
Name of last ship probably John
Listed separately under 'Account of Apprentices on Board'
Listed separately under 'Account of Apprentices on Board'
